Job description

Our Development Services Department is looking for a Statutory Planning Officer to join the Planning team. This is an opportunity to work closely with the Building services, Business Development and Engineering units to ensure important planning functions of Council, and the needs and expectations of our valued customers are met.

Are you planning professional with a positive ‘can do’ attitude and strong customer service skills? The successful candidate will need to be highly organised, have excellent written and verbal communication skills, good attention to detail and time management abilities, and be comfortable working to deadlines.

Applicants will need to have (as a minimum) tertiary qualifications in land use planning or a related discipline, or equivalent extensive experience in the planning field. Local government experience will be well regarded but is not essential. Graduate applications will be considered.

Please address your application to Karen Girvan, Coordinator Planning. Further information about the position can be obtained by downloading the position description attached or by calling Karen Girvan on 5772 0333.

To be competitive in the selection process, please address the selection criteria listed in the position description.

851900030:
[

Legal Counsel

Company Name Northern Trust Corporation Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 206 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who We Are

For more than a century, Northern Trust has worked hard building our legacy of outstanding service, expertise, and integrity. From a Chicago-based bank founded in 1889, we now have more than 20 international locations and 16,500 employees globally. We serve the world’s most-sophisticated clients – from sovereign wealth funds and the wealthiest individuals and families to the most-successful hedge funds and corporate brands.

What We Do

Northern Trust’s international business has grown dramatically over the last decade. Some of our largest clients are located in Asia and Australia, which represents a rapidly growing client base for the company. Since 1986, we have been serving clients in Asia-Pacific (APAC), including corporate pension funds, investment managers, insurance companies, government agencies, family offices and corporations. Our intricate understanding of the region allows us to provide unique insights and strategic perspectives to our clients. Currently, we have client offices in Beijing, Hong Kong, Seoul, Melbourne, Singapore, Tokyo and Kuala Lumpur.

The Opportunity

The role of Legal Counsel in our Melbourne office offers the opportunity to play a key role in the Asia Pacific Legal Department, supporting an important growth market for Northern Trust. The successful candidate will enjoy an autonomous role, working in close partnership with senior management and the business on a wide variety of legal matters for different Northern Trust products and services. Importantly, the role also offers the opportunity to achieve a healthy work/life balance, with a focus on outcomes rather than hours spent behind the desk.

What You Will Do
  • Negotiate, draft and/or review a wide range of legal agreements for the following services: custody, fund administration, middle office, investment management, securities lending, transition management, foreign exchange and other services
  • Review and negotiate ad hoc or ancillary legal documentation such as parental guarantees, non-disclosure agreements, service level agreements and powers of attorney
  • Negotiate, draft and review inter-company and vendor agreements in connection with the provision of client services
  • Instruct and liaise with external counsel in Australia and Asia Pacific, as necessary
  • Review and analyse advice and opinions from external counsel
  • Advise on legal and regulatory developments impacting Northern Trust in Australia and Asia Pacific
  • Advise on existing and new products and services (to be) offered to clients in Australia and Asia Pacific
  • Manage legal risk having regard for, amongst other things, regulatory change, good corporate governance and operating structures
  • Work with other members of the APAC Legal Department and the broader corporate Legal Department in relation to ad hoc projects and client requests


Knowledge, Skills & Qualifications
  • A minimum of 8+ years of experience working in-house with a domestic or global financial institution and/or in private practice with a reputable firm
  • Experience working in custody and/or funds management will be highly valued. Applicants with superannuation, securities lending, derivatives or brokerage experience will also be considered
  • Strong legal drafting and negotiation skills. Experience negotiating custody, fund administration and investment management agreements will be highly valued
  • Strong understanding of the Australian financial services regulatory environment including Chapter 7 of the Corporations Act
  • Pro-active and diligent team player with the ability to prioritise and work to set deadlines within a challenging environment
  • Strong commercial/pragmatic sense and understanding of business needs
  • The ability to analyse complex legal issues and explain outcomes in plain English
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • A self-starter who is able to work independently


As Of June 30, 2018, Northern Trust Corporation Had
  • $10.7 trillion in assets under custody/administration
  • $8.1 trillion in assets under custody
  • $1.1 trillion in assets under management
  • $135 billion in banking assets


Northern Trust is an equal opportunity employer. We aim for excellence in our efforts to recruit, develop and deploy the highest caliber workforce. Our commitment and success to a diverse workforce is evident in employee satisfaction and industry acknowledgment. For a list of all our achievements please click here.

The closing date to apply for this role is 17th September 2018 and we will be in touch with an update within two weeks.

For a private discussion please contact Gez Williams on +61 3 9935 8204.

Office Manager & People Operations Lead

Company Name Bolster Group Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 365 views

Job description

We’re a digital strategy, creative and product agency specialising in music, events and entertainment. We’re incredibly passionate about our clients and, hopefully, they’re on your radar too! We’re talking teams like Splendour in the Grass, St. Jerome’s Laneway Festival, Falls Festival, Chugg Entertainment, Fairfax Events and Future Classic, plus global lifestyle brands such as YouTube, JBL and Blundstone.
\xa0

Our diverse and energetic team is growing fast and we’re on the hunt for someone super organised to take the office management reigns. Your job will be to keep everything moving. You’ll be two steps ahead at all times, intuitively taking care of the details, so the team can focus on the stuff they do best.
\xa0

If you have the ability to make order out of chaos while remaining calm and flexible with ever-changing priorities and needs, then this is the role for you.

\xa0

The Role:
\xa0

You’ll act as the office ambassador, ensuring all team members have what they need to be productive. That includes:

  • Keep the office running like clockwork and looking great.
  • Organise company events and outings, from Friday afternoon drinks to staff retreats.
  • Assist with meeting scheduling and make travel arrangements for the team.
  • Manage office supplies and vendor / service provider agreements
  • Assist with the onboarding and setup of new staff.
  • Champion the Bolster brand by assisting with culture initiatives.
  • Assist finance manager with basic bookkeeping duties
  • Act as assistant to the directors

\xa0

Requirements
  • Formidable organisation skills - people fear your lists and spreadsheets.
  • Ability to communicate clearly with all levels of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Understand the need for confidentiality and discretion.
  • An unshakeable efficiency and adaptability to change - ours is a fast-paced environment!
  • A lateral thinker, with an ability to create and manage processes.
  • A positive, cheerful and calm demeanour that sets the tone.
  • Solid proficiency in microsoft excel, google docs, email and task management software (ie: Asana, trello)
  • Apply a proactive approach to getting things done.
  • At least one year experience in a similar role within a creative/digital/music business.

Job description


  • Exciting agricultural sales role
  • Outstanding customer service; experience in sales
  • Based in Pakenham; iconic brand

Elders has played a key role in rural Australia for more than 175 years. As a leading agribusiness, we are committed to providing our clients with a solution that meets their needs across every aspect of their farming business. We are committed to delivering value to the local communities in which we operate and the future of Australia’s agricultural industry.

The Role

Apply your expertise in agricultural chemical products and the farming sector for the purposes of building strong client relationships to achieve sales and earnings targets by

  • Providing timely and accurate advice and recommendations about farm supplies
  • Performing farm supplies sales and quotes
  • Identifying and developing sales opportunities and referrals
  • Assisting in the storage, handling, receiving and dispatching of stock

Reporting to the Farm Supplies Sales Manager, this role will liaise with people from across the business and will play an active role in representing Elders in campaigns, field days, community events and forums.

The Person

  • Previous sales experience and, ideally, a successful sales record in a rural farm supplies business
  • Committed to the provision of high-quality customer service;
  • Possess an understanding of agriculture products;
  • Understanding your clients’ current and future needs, the region and our competitors;
  • Demonstrated high-quality written and verbal communication and customer service skills;
  • Ability to work independently and have good time management skills;
  • Although not essential, a qualification in an agricultural or related business discipline will be highly regarded.

This is a great opportunity to join a dedicated team, who is passionate about Australian agribusiness.

Apply now for this unique opportunity or for more information call Peter Rollason, Branch Manager on 0419 600 323.

Applications close 16 September 2018

At Elders, we want our people to reflect the communities we operate in, and encourage applications from a diverse range of people, backgrounds and experiences. We encourage a positive work-life balance through a range of flexible work options.

848620249:
[

Technical Account Manager

Company Name Doghouse Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 164 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Doghouse Agency is a fast-growing, award winning Australian digital agency with an exciting portfolio of diverse, high profile clients. We pride ourselves on our vibrant culture, innovative minds and enthusiasm for the latest in technology and design trends.


We’re a close knit team of 27 in-house, headquartered in Perth and offices in Melbourne. As a boutique agency we’re nimble and agile. Most importantly, we believe in reinforcing a strong culture around the work we do.


With a strong emphasis on technology and development, we tell it how it is and aim to deliver best-in-breed solutions that balance quality and pragmatism to deliver solid value for money results.


About the role


We are seeking an experienced Technical Account Manager to join us and pave the way for our team. Working closely with the Director and all departments, you will acquire new business through your pointed RFx responses and engage with existing clients to identify and pursue new opportunities.


We’re seeking someone that is not only going to join the Doghouse family but provide vision, creativity, inspiration and best practice solutions. You will work collaboratively with all teams and stakeholders to win business and build long-term relationships.


Key Accountabilities include;


  • Manage and assess new business leads, working alongside the Director, qualifying and ranking opportunities to ensure a decision to respond to a request aligns with business strategies, partnerships and capabilities

  • Gather requirements by reviewing provided briefing materials and engaging with new and existing stakeholders to discover business and technical requirements

  • Coordinate internal and external Subject Matter Experts as necessary to produce Solutions Architecture & Functional Specifications

  • Based on solutions, coordinate, prepare and deliver project estimates, project timelines and resource schedules

  • In assembling a proposal response package, ensure all input from SMEs provides a unified and coherent vision for the project with a clear value proposition for the client

  • Responsible for proposal response submission, working alongside the Director throughout and ongoing follow-up throughout the evaluation process, providing additional information and pitch materials as needed

  • Coordinate, prepare and deliver pitch presentations and technical discovery workshops, proactively demonstrating the value of our team and capabilities

  • Upon contract commencement, facilitate handover to internal production teams to ensure the overall project vision, structure and requirements are fully understood by all

  • Encourage process, champion process adoption

  • Define process and ensure buy in from team

  • Follow-up with PM and key resources throughout implementation to ensure proposed solutions are being delivered as planned

  • Work closely with the Director to communicate requirements for successful proposal delivery

  • Align solutions with, and provide input into the technical direction and strategy of the business

  • Networking and Business Development activity.


Key Skills & Attributes;


  • Effective communication and management of project teams, from technical and marketing teams

  • Exceptional leadership, ability to inspire, mobilise and invigorate teams to ensure a successful outcome

  • Strong experience and working knowledge of project management

  • Stakeholder communication and management at all levels, confidence communicating with ‘C Level’ stakeholders and directors of large Govt & Enterprise organisations

  • Ability to provide innovative and practical solutions to complex technical briefs

  • Exceptional presentation skills and the ability to read the audience, know the client and required approach

  • Strong technical background with an emphasis on open source, LAMP & cloud based architectures (AWS, Drupal, Magento, Laravel experience highly regarded)

  • In-depth understanding of data integrations, service-oriented architectures, decoupled systems, message queueing and Enterprise Integration patterns

  • Ability to self-manage and prioritise solutions and proposals based on a range of values

  • Constantly keeping up to date with relevant advances in the technology and business landscape

  • Strong networking and business development ability, involvement in relevant communities and advocating Doghouse products and services.

  • Passionate about the industry and dedicated to continual development and exposure and ongoing interest in adopting new technology and process from Devops to Designops, Cloud, ML, IoT, containerisation - be on top of where technology is now and in the future!


Key Experience;


  • Demonstrated experience with Federal and State Government procurement processes

  • A track record of success in winning large and high profile projects

  • Familiarity and confidence working with clients of all sizes, especially large enterprise organisations

  • Ideally 10 years experience in a solutions-focussed account management role

  • Web Agency experience highly preferable, critical to understand the dynamic of agency/client relationship.\xa0


Education & Qualifications;


  • Qualifications in Computer Science, Digital Media and / or Business Background highly regarded

  • Project management certifications, e.g. Agile Scrum or Prince2 highly regarded

  • Training and certification in networking and cloud technologies, e.g. AWS / Cisco.

Business Systems Development Analyst

Company Name Asaleo Care Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 46 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Organisation

Asaleo Care is built on strong traditions. Past generations have worked tirelessly to build our knowledge, best-in-class technology, market leading brands and customer relationships.

When you join us you become part of a team of 1,000 employees working across Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific Islands. We are proud of our brands and what we can achieve together. With pride and passion we move forward. We are always seeking to do things better.

What sets us apart is a strong ethos of taking care. Nothing is more important than taking care of our consumers, customers, communities, shareholders, each other and the environment.

We roll-up our sleeves and support one another to succeed. Our people gain exposure to a wide range of work and projects and are involved every step of the journey. We strive for results and work hard to achieve our common goals. Our diverse and inclusive environment fosters ideas and innovation whilst growing and developing your career.

We know you'll find Asaleo Care to be a workplace where everyone is welcome.

We are always seeking talented people to join our team and help us grow.

Are you ready to make difference?

The Role

Reporting to the Team leader IT Operations, the Business Systems Development Analyst will be responsible for the timely and cost effective development and support of high quality computer applications complying with the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) processes in place that support Asaleo Care's business processes.

Key areas of focus will include:
  • Being the Microsoft stack software solution architect covering sales and manufacturing systems;
  • Working autonomously on projects related to various business software systems, web applications and MSSQL databases;
  • Ensure the daily operational and maintenance tasks are completed to ensure a robust operation of the various MSSQL applications.

The Person

To be considered for this position you will be able to demonstrate the following;
  • Excellent, demonstrated hands on MSSQL development skills are mandatory with a good understanding of overall system integration
  • Development and administration of MSSQL server
  • Application development using MS Visual Studio
  • Strong analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills
  • Good documentation and communication skills

What's in it for you?

As an FMCG business, we have a large number of tier one brands which gives you a strong platform to see your day to day work in consumer homes. Come and join us to be part of this success story.

Please note, you must hold Australian permanent residence to apply for this position.

To apply please click the 'Apply Now' button below.
